p: RNA-Seq was performed on an Illumina HiSeq4000 platform (Novogene, Singapore) to generate 150 bp paired-end reads. After trimming the poor-quality reads and adaptor sequences, the clean reads were then mapped onto the reference genome of Elaeis guineensis available in NCBI database under accession number PRJNA192219, using TopHat2 algorithm with a maximum of 2 mismatches. Transcript abundance in FPKM was estimated using HTSeq with union mode. For differential expression analysis, DESeq with a corrected p-values < 0.05 was employed. All DEGs were then subjected to the GO term overrepresentation test using GOseq [ 93]. Regulatory pathways were investigated by matching DEGs to putative orthologs in the Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes (KEGG) protein database ( www.genome.jp/dbget/) [ 94].
